segment.source: MD Conversion - Help protect your data with remote wipe, remote lock, or passcode reset using Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Help protect your data with remote wipe, remote lock, or passcode reset using Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Help protect your data with remote wipe, remote lock, or passcode reset using Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Help protect your data with remote wipe, remote lock, or passcode reset using Microsoft Intune

segment.source: provides selective wipe, full wipe, remote lock, and passcode reset capabilities.
segment.target: provides selective wipe, full wipe, remote lock, and passcode reset capabilities.

segment.source: Because mobile devices can store sensitive corporate data and provide access to many corporate resources, you can issue a remote device wipe command from the to wipe a lost or stolen device.
segment.target: Because mobile devices can store sensitive corporate data and provide access to many corporate resources, you can issue a remote device wipe command from the to wipe a lost or stolen device.

segment.source: Also, users can issue a remote device wipe command from the on privately owned devices enrolled in Intune.
segment.target: Also, users can issue a remote device wipe command from the on privately owned devices enrolled in Intune.

segment.source: This topic is only about wiping devices managed by Intune.
segment.target: This topic is only about wiping devices managed by Intune.

segment.source: You can also use the Azure preview portal to wipe company data from apps.
segment.target: You can also use the Azure preview portal to wipe company data from apps.

segment.source: Use Retire/Wipe to help secure a lost device or to retire a device from active use
segment.target: Use Retire/Wipe to help secure a lost device or to retire a device from active use

segment.source: Full wipe restores a device to its factory default settings, removing all company and user data and settings.
segment.target: Full wipe restores a device to its factory default settings, removing all company and user data and settings.

segment.source: The device is removed from Intune.
segment.target: The device is removed from Intune.

segment.source: Be careful about selecting full wipe; your data cannot be recovered.
segment.target: Be careful about selecting full wipe; your data cannot be recovered.

segment.source: Selective wipe removes company data from a device.
segment.target: Selective wipe removes company data from a device.

segment.source: The device is removed from Intune.
segment.target: The device is removed from Intune.

segment.source: The following tables describe by platform what data is removed and the effect on data that remains on the device after a selective wipe.
segment.target: The following tables describe by platform what data is removed and the effect on data that remains on the device after a selective wipe.

segment.source: Company apps and associated data installed by .
segment.target: Company apps and associated data installed by .

segment.source: App data from Microsoft apps that use mobile app management is removed.
segment.target: App data from Microsoft apps that use mobile app management is removed.

segment.source: Configurations that were set by policy are no longer enforced and users can change the settings.
segment.target: Configurations that were set by policy are no longer enforced and users can change the settings.

segment.source: Email profiles that are provisioned through are removed and cached email on the device is deleted.
segment.target: Email profiles that are provisioned through are removed and cached email on the device is deleted.

segment.source: Apps are uninstalled and data local to app is removed as a result.
segment.target: Apps are uninstalled and data local to app is removed as a result.

segment.source: No data outside the app (SD card, etc.) is removed.
segment.target: No data outside the app (SD card, etc.) is removed.

segment.source: Data protected by MAM encryption outside the app (SD card, etc.) remain encrypted but aren't removed.
segment.target: Data protected by MAM encryption outside the app (SD card, etc.) remain encrypted but aren't removed.

segment.source: Data protected by MAM encryption outside the app (SD card, etc.) remain encrypted but aren't removed.
segment.target: Data protected by MAM encryption outside the app (SD card, etc.) remain encrypted but aren't removed.

segment.source: Data protected by MAM encryption outside the app (SD card, etc.) remain encrypted but aren't removed.
segment.target: Data protected by MAM encryption outside the app (SD card, etc.) remain encrypted but aren't removed.

segment.source: Data protected by MAM encryption outside the app (SD card, etc.) remain encrypted but aren't removed.
segment.target: Data protected by MAM encryption outside the app (SD card, etc.) remain encrypted but aren't removed.

segment.source: Configurations that were set by policy are no longer enforced and users can change the settings.
segment.target: Configurations that were set by policy are no longer enforced and users can change the settings.

segment.source: Configurations that were set by policy are no longer enforced and users can change the settings.
segment.target: Configurations that were set by policy are no longer enforced and users can change the settings.

segment.source: Email received by the Microsoft Outlook app for Android app is removed.
segment.target: Email received by the Microsoft Outlook app for Android app is removed.

segment.source: Email profiles that are provisioned through are removed and cached email on the device is deleted.
segment.target: Email profiles that are provisioned through are removed and cached email on the device is deleted.

segment.source: Windows 8.1 (enrolled as a mobile device) and Windows RT 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1 (enrolled as a mobile device) and Windows RT 8.1

segment.source: Company apps and associated data installed by .
segment.target: Company apps and associated data installed by .

segment.source: Files protected by EFS will have their key revoked and the user will not be able to open the files.
segment.target: Files protected by EFS will have their key revoked and the user will not be able to open the files.

segment.source: Apps originally installed through the company portal are uninstalled.
segment.target: Apps originally installed through the company portal are uninstalled.

segment.source: Configurations that were set by policy are no longer enforced and users can change the settings.
segment.target: Configurations that were set by policy are no longer enforced and users can change the settings.

segment.source: Configurations that were set by policy are no longer enforced and users can change the settings.
segment.target: Configurations that were set by policy are no longer enforced and users can change the settings.

segment.source: Configurations that were set by policy are no longer enforced and users can change the settings.
segment.target: Configurations that were set by policy are no longer enforced and users can change the settings.

segment.source: Removes email that is EFS enabled which includes the Mail app for Windows email and attachments.
segment.target: Removes email that is EFS enabled which includes the Mail app for Windows email and attachments.

segment.source: Email profiles that are provisioned through are removed and cached email on the device is deleted.
segment.target: Email profiles that are provisioned through are removed and cached email on the device is deleted.

segment.source: To remotely wipe a device from the Intune administrator console
segment.target: To remotely wipe a device from the Intune administrator console

segment.source: You can find them either by user or by device.
segment.target: You can find them either by user or by device.

segment.source: In the Intune administrator console, click Groups > All Users.
segment.target: In the Intune administrator console, click Groups > All Users.

segment.source: Click the name of the user whose mobile device you want to wipe.
segment.target: Click the name of the user whose mobile device you want to wipe.

segment.source: On the user's Properties page, click Devices, and then click the name of the mobile device you want to wipe.
segment.target: On the user's Properties page, click Devices, and then click the name of the mobile device you want to wipe.

segment.source: In the Intune administrator console, click Groups > All Mobile Devices.
segment.target: In the Intune administrator console, click Groups > All Mobile Devices.

segment.source: Click Devices, and then click the name of the mobile device you want to wipe.
segment.target: Click Devices, and then click the name of the mobile device you want to wipe.

segment.source: A message appears, prompting you to confirm whether you want to retire the device.
segment.target: A message appears, prompting you to confirm whether you want to retire the device.

segment.source: To perform a Selective wipe which only removes company apps and data, click Yes.
segment.target: To perform a Selective wipe which only removes company apps and data, click Yes.

segment.source: To perform a Full wipe that erases all apps and data and returns the device to factory default settings, select Wipe the device before retiring.
segment.target: To perform a Full wipe that erases all apps and data and returns the device to factory default settings, select Wipe the device before retiring.

segment.source: This action applies to all platforms except Windows 8.1.
segment.target: This action applies to all platforms except Windows 8.1.

segment.source: You cannot recover data removed by a full wipe.
segment.target: You cannot recover data removed by a full wipe.

segment.source: It takes less than 15 minutes for a wipe to propagate across all device types.
segment.target: It takes less than 15 minutes for a wipe to propagate across all device types.

segment.source: Selective wipe of EFS-encrypted content is supported by Windows 8.1 and Windows RT 8.1.
segment.target: Selective wipe of EFS-encrypted content is supported by Windows 8.1 and Windows RT 8.1.

segment.source: The following apply to a selective wipe of EFS-enabled content:
segment.target: The following apply to a selective wipe of EFS-enabled content:

segment.source: Only apps and data that are protected by EFS using the same Internet domain as the account are selectively wiped.
segment.target: Only apps and data that are protected by EFS using the same Internet domain as the account are selectively wiped.

segment.source: For more information, see Windows Selective Wipe for Device Data Management.
segment.target: For more information, see Windows Selective Wipe for Device Data Management.

segment.source: If there are any changes are made to the domain associated with EFS, the changes can take up to 48 hours before apps and data using the new domain can be selectively wiped.
segment.target: If there are any changes are made to the domain associated with EFS, the changes can take up to 48 hours before apps and data using the new domain can be selectively wiped.

segment.source: Each domain that is registered with will be wiped.
segment.target: Each domain that is registered with will be wiped.

segment.source: The data and apps that are currently supported by EFS selective wipe are:
segment.target: The data and apps that are currently supported by EFS selective wipe are:

segment.source: Files and folders encrypted by EFS.
segment.target: Files and folders encrypted by EFS.

segment.source: For more information, see Best practices for the Encrypting File System.
segment.target: For more information, see Best practices for the Encrypting File System.

segment.source: If your organization maintains its identity in Active Directory, it must use the Directory Sync (DirSync) tool to sync information into AAD for EFS selective wipe to work correctly.
segment.target: If your organization maintains its identity in Active Directory, it must use the Directory Sync (DirSync) tool to sync information into AAD for EFS selective wipe to work correctly.

segment.source: For more information on DirSync, see Directory Sync Scenario in the Azure Active Directory documentation.
segment.target: For more information on DirSync, see Directory Sync Scenario in the Azure Active Directory documentation.

segment.source: Monitor retire, wipe, and delete actions
segment.target: Monitor retire, wipe, and delete actions

segment.source: To get a report of devices that have been retired, wiped, or deleted, and who performed the action:
segment.target: To get a report of devices that have been retired, wiped, or deleted, and who performed the action:

segment.source: In the Intune administrator console, click Reports > Device History Reports.
segment.target: In the Intune administrator console, click Reports > Device History Reports.

segment.source: Provide a start and end date for the report, then click View Report.
segment.target: Provide a start and end date for the report, then click View Report.

segment.source: Reset the passcode on a device
segment.target: Reset the passcode on a device

segment.source: If a user forgets their passcode, you can help them by removing the passcode from a device or by forcing a new temporary passcode on a device.
segment.target: If a user forgets their passcode, you can help them by removing the passcode from a device or by forcing a new temporary passcode on a device.

segment.source: The table below lists how passcode reset works on different mobile platforms.
segment.target: The table below lists how passcode reset works on different mobile platforms.

segment.source: Supported for clearing the passcode from a device.
segment.target: Supported for clearing the passcode from a device.

segment.source: Does not create a new temporary passcode.
segment.target: Does not create a new temporary passcode.

segment.source: Supported and a temporary passcode is created.
segment.target: Supported and a temporary passcode is created.

segment.source: To reset the passcode on a mobile device remotely through the Microsoft Intune console
segment.target: To reset the passcode on a mobile device remotely through the Microsoft Intune console

segment.source: In the Intue administrator console, click Groups > All Devices > All Mobile Devices.
segment.target: In the Intue administrator console, click Groups > All Devices > All Mobile Devices.

segment.source: Click All Direct Managed Devices for devices enrolled in Intune or All Exchange ActiveSync Managed Devices.
segment.target: Click All Direct Managed Devices for devices enrolled in Intune or All Exchange ActiveSync Managed Devices.

segment.source: You can also navigate to a device by user.
segment.target: You can also navigate to a device by user.

segment.source: On the user's properties page, click Devices, and then click the name of the mobile device you want to wipe.
segment.target: On the user's properties page, click Devices, and then click the name of the mobile device you want to wipe.

segment.source: In the list, click the device or devices that you want to lock.
segment.target: In the list, click the device or devices that you want to lock.

segment.source: On the taskbar, click Remote Tasks, and select Passcode Reset.
segment.target: On the taskbar, click Remote Tasks, and select Passcode Reset.

segment.source: If a user loses their device you can lock the device remotely.
segment.target: If a user loses their device you can lock the device remotely.

segment.source: The table below lists how remote lock works on different mobile platforms.
segment.target: The table below lists how remote lock works on different mobile platforms.

segment.source: Supported if the current user of the device is the same user who enrolled the device.
segment.target: Supported if the current user of the device is the same user who enrolled the device.

segment.source: Supported if the current user of the device is the same user who enrolled the device.
segment.target: Supported if the current user of the device is the same user who enrolled the device.

segment.source: To lock a mobile device remotely through the Microsoft Intune console
segment.target: To lock a mobile device remotely through the Microsoft Intune console

segment.source: In the Intune administrator console, click Groups > All Devices > All Mobile Devices.
segment.target: In the Intune administrator console, click Groups > All Devices > All Mobile Devices.

segment.source: Click All Direct Managed Devices for devices enrolled in Intune or All Exchange ActiveSync Managed Devices.
segment.target: Click All Direct Managed Devices for devices enrolled in Intune or All Exchange ActiveSync Managed Devices.

segment.source: You can also navigate to a device by user.
segment.target: You can also navigate to a device by user.

segment.source: On the user's properties page, click Devices, and then click the name of the mobile device you want to wipe.
segment.target: On the user's properties page, click Devices, and then click the name of the mobile device you want to wipe.

segment.source: In the list, click the device or devices that you want to lock.
segment.target: In the list, click the device or devices that you want to lock.

segment.source: On the taskbar, click Remote Tasks, and select Remote Lock.
segment.target: On the taskbar, click Remote Tasks, and select Remote Lock.

segment.source: Retire data and devices from Microsoft Intune management
segment.target: Retire data and devices from Microsoft Intune management

segment.source: Windows Selective Wipe for Device Data Management
segment.target: Windows Selective Wipe for Device Data Management
